Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: NEW KINGDOM (not after); 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not before)
Name: Vase
Description: Good quality small oval-shaped vase. The neck is narrow, the lip flared and rounded. The clay is fine, buff-coloured and compact, with an organic temper, but relatively friable. It had been covered with a red ochre slip, polished and burnished (vertically polished with a hard object). Several concentric stripes adorn the neck and the shoulder, the first three being very noticeable.
